# Où Sont Les Développeuses (OSLD)

> Directory and community for women developers in France.

## Mission

OSLD makes women developers visible in France. Women represent less than 20% of the tech industry. OSLD exists to change that through visibility, community, and inspiration.

## Features

### Developer Directory (public)
Profiles of women developers in France. Filterable by city, technology, and availability (freelance, permanent contract, mentoring, conference speaking, coffee chat, pair programming, CV review).
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/directory

### Speakers (public)
Find women tech speakers for your conferences and events. Filterable by topic, remote/on-site availability.
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/speakers

### Companies (public)
Reviews and feedback on tech companies by the community. "Certified Inclusive" badge for companies with 5+ positive reviews.
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/companies

### Programs & Resources (public)
Communities, training, and mentorship for women developers: Duchess France, Rails Girls, and more.
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/programs

### Podcasts (public)
Tech podcast episodes featuring women developers. Career paths, experiences, and tech discussions.
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/podcasts

### Quiz "What kind of dev are you?" (public)
AI-powered quiz to discover your developer profile. 5 questions, personalized portrait.
URL: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr/experience

### Le QG (private, GitHub login required)
Private space for registered developers. Technical help (bugs, code reviews, advice), collaborative side projects, community job offers (permanent, freelance, internship, apprenticeship).

## Key Information

- Website: https://ousontlesdeveloppeuses.fr
- Source code: https://github.com/Kamsou/ousontlesdevs (100% open source)
- Stack: Nuxt 4, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Drizzle ORM, Turso
- Language: French
- Country: France
- Created by: Camille, developer with 8 years of experience

## Tone & Positioning

OSLD is an inclusive and supportive project. The tone is direct, human, and free of corporate jargon. The site is for women and non-binary people in tech, as well as anyone looking to collaborate with them (recruiters, event organizers, companies).

## Contact

For any questions, use the contact form on the website or open a GitHub Issue.
